Basic site structure

How to set up the basic site structure

Back to home Managing Pages

Setting up the Basics

The first thing you will need to do is refer to a Sitemap.

You will then need to follow this order when setting up the basics:

  1. Set up Groups
  2. Set up Pages
  3. Set up Menus

Please see below for more information on each of the steps.

1. Adding Groups

Every page will need a group, so it is important to set these up before you start adding any pages. If you realise you need more groups, these can be added at anytime. By creating the groups first this will allow:

  • URLs to show the correct path to the page
  • Breadcrumbs to work
  • Adding menus

Without a group, you will not be able to add a menu.

HELP If you need a refresher on how to set up Groups you can view guidelines here.

2. Adding Pages

Now you have all your groups set up, you will need to set up the pages.

  • All the pages that are going to be the first one in a group will need a slug of index. Otherwise the URL could potentially read i.e. our-team/our-team
  • Make sure that you assign the layout of default to every page

HELP If you need a refresher on how to set up Pages you can view guidelines here.

3. Adding Groups

No you have added all your pages, you will need to create menus. You will need to set up the following:

  • Main navigation (this will be under the group Index)
  • Set up submenus (if any). Remember once you have set up the menu, you will then need to assign it to an item in the main naviation
  • Footer links

HELP If you need a refresher on how to set up Menus you can view guidelines here.
